content.raw:
Altough the automation mechanism is really cool, I'm worried that we are introducing a "hack" that could represent limitation to extend funcionality or problems in maintenance in the future. My doubts are:

 * We are somewhat abusing of stderr: if someone call a binary --help, probably would expect result in stdout, not in stderr. There is no error in running that command. Does the code using boost program_options support cerr output? 

 * We are running make_ronn in all generated binaries, expecting them to implement ```-h``` and always generating man pages no matter what output it could produce. 

 * We are running, during compilation, the own results of compilation to generate output and need them to produce the output of ```-h``` without any other code check or code integration (help output need to happen completely independent).

I'm not sure about the goodness of automation this time, but I can live with it if you guys believie that it will produce more happiness than hurt.
